title: Building a Nation
subtle:
Historical (nonfiction), 2,079 words, Level Z (Grade 5), Lexile 980L            
                        
		Multilevel Book also available in levels                     Z1 and Z2
description: What happened after the thirteen colonies declared independence from Great Britain?  Building a Nation is an informational book that is a continuation of Seeds of Revolution and Battling for Independence. The book can also be used to teach students how to analyze problem and solution and the proper use of compound adjectives. The book and lesson are also available for levels Z1 and Z2.
highFrequencyWords: checks and balances, compromise, constitution, debates, debts, executive, expansion, federal, guaranteed, judicial, legislative, prosperity, ratify, rebellion, representatives, seizing, treaty, tyranny
reviewWords: Use of vocabulary lessons requires a subscription to VocabularyA-Z.com.
comprehension: Compound Adjectives                : Identify and use compound adjectives
awareness: Prepositional Phrases                : Understand the use of prepositional phrases within sentences
